intro: Tragacantha brachycentra, commonly known as the narrow-headed tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a distinctive resin, which has been historically used in various traditional applications. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
